John 'Kable' Tillman.Action: Maintains stoic silence and does not respond to Sandra's attempt at connection.
Meditates or shows internalized emotion in a harsh environment, suggesting inward focus and resilience rather than engagement with others.
Focused, determined; eyes burning with internalized emotion; remains stoic and does not respond to provocation while being roughly treated.
Does not verbally engage or respond in tense situations, potentially indicating strategic restraint.
Uses his elbow to help Sandra back up despite his own pain and restraints.
Bears pain silently without complaint.
Wants to rip the guard apart in violent rage.
Leaps through the air in slow-motion and lands in an overdramatic, rockstar pose.
Multicolored LEDs on his weapon activate with turrets spinning into place, preparing for 'Go time'.
Slides behind cover quickly after emerging, anticipating incoming fire.
Saves an East-Indian woman from getting obliterated by shoving her out of the way of a blazing truck.
Shows cold eyes with faint emotion after saving the woman.
Gives covering fire to Sandra as she runs to him, waits for her to catch up before moving to cover
Turns and kills two enemies without hesitation after Sandra is killed
Points weapon at a guard's head in anger after battle, showing murderous intent.
Does not respond to guards' laughter or taunts, and remains silent and withdrawn afterwards.
Quietly corrects others by stating 'My name's Tillman' instead of accepting casual address.
Remains silent and composed when a fellow soldier doubts survival chances.
Does not verbally reassure or visibly react to the challenge about limited battles left.
Kable is described as 'unbelievable' with impressive physical capability (his arms)
Sits quietly alone, watching a crippled prisoner struggling, expressionless but attentive.
Recalls a memory of a loving, joyful moment with a little girl and her father, implying emotional depth.
Does not engage with Freek's attempt at conversation, turns slowly to look him in the eye but says nothing, then looks away.
Admits to killing his best friend when directly asked why he is imprisoned.
Maintains calm and unflinching composure after Freek describes the deadly environment and his own fears; does not react or get rattled.
Does not respond verbally when prompted repeatedly by Freek, but instead looks directly into his eyes and then looks away, demonstrating controlled restraint and confidence.
Waits a good long beat before answering Freek's question about why he is imprisoned, indicating deliberate and thoughtful communication.
Reluctantly signs a notecard for a fan's child despite confusion and suspicion.
Does not immediately trust the woman, questions her motives and remains guarded.
Stunned and silent upon receiving the photo, hesitant to engage but eventually signs the notecard reluctantly.
Steels himself emotionally despite the pain caused by the woman's words, showing internal strength.
Urgently holds up a wrinkled photo to the door, asking questions about it.
Peers intently through the door window, showing concern and attention to detail.
Focuses intensely on physical training and pushing himself beyond exhaustion alone.
Holds the wrinkled photo to the door window and questions the woman to gain information.
Peers through the door window looking for the woman after she leaves, but fails to catch her or get further information.
Pushes himself physically to exhaustion running laps on the prison track, demonstrating endurance and mental focus.
Continues pushing physically to exhaustion despite staggering near collapse, ultimately breaking down alone on the running track.
Staggers near collapse, lungs burning, breaks down to jog and doubles over gasping for breath, appears insignificant and alone on the track.
Leaps for a drainage trench, making it successfully and moving tactically behind cover.
Takes position at a second-floor vantage point and uses sniper sight to lock on target showing tactical awareness and skill.
Hears subtle sound of an approaching threat behind him but remains focused on his targets, risking being caught off guard.
Tries desperately to communicate by whispering 'Turn me around God damn it...' showing vulnerability and a plea for help.
Focuses on survival and fighting off enemies rather than showing concern or interaction with others in the chaotic moment.
Notices subtle sounds behind him that the player controlling him hasn't, showing heightened situational awareness.
Struggles helplessly against the external control, trying to influence his player but unable to do so.
Quickly reacts to an ambush by spinning fast and firing an armor-piercing shell that surprises and neutralizes an opponent.
Successfully escapes a collapsing floor under heavy fire while taking shrapnel but relying on body armor, showing survival instincts and composure.
Sees a save point but only hesitates briefly before continuing to run from an imminent explosion.
Runs and looks back over shoulder at rushing flame indicating awareness and quick reaction under pressure.
Watches a sobbing Brown soldier and wonders who is controlling them, showing reflective and questioning mindset but no direct action.
Shoots the other man in the head decisively in a tense situation, indicating clear and confident action under pressure.
Appears via low-fi surveillance footage, showing ability to remain hidden and operational in difficult circumstances.
Looks on impassive, internalizing emotion as fellow prisoner gruesomely self-mutilates and dies.
Calls a hostile, threatening new prisoner a 'Freak' under his breath.
Looks on impassive and internalizes emotion during a horrific scene of a prisoner self-mutilating and dying, indicating calmness under pressure.
Notices and assesses a threatening new prisoner (Hackman), recognizing danger quickly and confidently labeling him as dangerous with a small verbal response.
Responds with confusion but no hostility when asked about Hackman; no aggressive or unfriendly reaction noted.
Takes part in training range, focuses carefully and deliberately, but intentionally misses targets by aiming off to the side.
Loads weapon carefully, deliberately pans sight off target to a specific point, and pulls trigger achieving a hit that affects multiple targets in a training range setting.
Is momentarily caught off guard by guard's question about who aims.
Struggles with wanting to keep conversation brief but feels grateful for human interaction.
Focuses on explaining his experience and limitation during the game, sharing insight openly.
Explains complex combat mechanics with clarity demonstrating understanding of the game and his role in it.
Successfully lands a precise headshot on Hackman showing skill and calm under pressure.
Takes a moment of self-reflection, demonstrating awareness of the physical toll but remains composed, indicating resilience and confidence.
Feels like he may be talking too much or revealing vulnerability, suggesting slight insecurity or overthinking in social interaction.
Refuses to engage with Hackman's taunts and refuses to make eye contact, demonstrating restraint.
Responds coldly and protectively when Hackman mentions 'two whores, Kable', showing care for the people Hackman insulted.
Shows no sympathy or tolerance toward Hackman's disturbed behavior and violent boasting, maintaining emotional distance.
Responds calmly and dismissively to Hackman's provocation, avoids eye contact, prepares for instant violence but maintains control.
Does not react emotionally to Hackman's taunts and maintains focus on the situation.
Instantly goes all business upon receiving information and immediately attempts to locate and confront Hackman.
Frustratedly slams a fist into a locker after failing to find Hackman where expected.
Lasts over a dozen sessions with the same I-con, showing tactical skill and instincts that give him an edge.
Described as a perfect soldier, a tactical killing computer dropped in with common murderers, implying he adapts and excels beyond expectations.
Responds to Simon's voice and acknowledges him with a terse but not hostile response.
Sprints through a dangerous tunnel, successfully evades sniper bullets by ducking and rolling, and reaches cover despite intense combat conditions.
Initially is confused or disoriented by hearing the voice of Simon controlling him, showing a moment of hesitation.
Finishes the pop-lock dance move goofy, echoing synchronized dance with Simon.
Tells Simon 'No. Pay attention to the game.' sharply.
Does not shoot an unarmed, obviously distressed blue soldier.
Scrambles for cover quickly and effectively after a shell impacts nearby.
Orders Simon to pay attention to the game, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Rolls and fires armor-piercing shells accurately, taking out multiple enemies efficiently.
Echoes Simon’s poses on the 3D screen in a synchronized manner, demonstrating coordination.
Chooses not to shoot an unarmed enemy who is panicked, showing controlled judgment rather than rash aggression.
Refuses to shoot an unarmed opponent.
Shows distress at the violent death of Freek, recognizing victims as real humans.
Rejects Simon's callous justification for killing, expressing moral outrage.
Observes the battlefield carefully, picks up on the presence of a familiar ally (FREEK) amid chaos, but unable to intervene when FREEK is hit.
Questions how he is still alive in a deadly situation, showing situational awareness and self-assessment.
Does not shoot an unarmed opponent, suggesting self-restraint or tactical patience.
Reacts emotionally (burning) to the killing of humans, indicating possible internal conflict that might affect cold calculation.
Uses a built-in light on his weapon and deploys a fly cam to scan the environment independently, effectively giving multiple perspectives.
Shows confident navigation underground by identifying the correct exit (P-4) and directs Simon accordingly.
Disregards Simon's doubt about a restricted area and confidently asserts going the correct way based on his prior experience (house-to-house in Tehran).
Grunts and silently looks down the block, then leads away from restricted area despite sarcastic warning.
Engages in violent fight sequence, struggling against Hackman who attacks him aggressively.
Notices the mortar shell inches from his face in ultra slow motion and reacts instantly by running away.
Is caught off guard and disarmed by Hackman, knocked down and threatened at close range.
Seizes the opportunity to incapacitate Hackman using physical aggression to save himself.
Speaks conspiratorially and sincerely to Simon, warning him of the danger and asking for trust and autonomy.
Mentions self-sacrificial acceptance ('Kid's gonna get me killed') indicating concern for others' safety.
Jams a foot into Hackman's balls, buckling him, twists his legs into a pretzel and throws him off after being nearly killed by a shotgun.
Recognizes he was targeted for death and communicates clearly the gravity of the situation to Simon, insisting on being turned loose to win.
Refuses to passively accept death and shows situational awareness despite injury and danger.
Does not immediately explain how to 'turn him loose' or provide a direct solution, leaving Simon confused.
Acknowledges elements of luck in survival, showing awareness of uncertainty and danger.
Has knowledge and past experiences that intimidate others but may also put him at risk.
No direct actions shown in this excerpt; others discuss his situation and competence indirectly.
Runs his thumb across a faded photo tenderly, caressing the lines
Engages cautiously but shows openness in responding to the woman's message, asking what she can get him, signaling trust and willingness to cooperate.
Refuses to claim having a friend, indicating emotional guardedness or distrust.
Listens carefully to the mysterious woman's warning without dismissing it, showing thoughtfulness and strategic thinking about the unwinnable nature of the game.
Chooses to request something from the woman despite uncertainty, indicating resourcefulness and decisiveness.
Does not openly show panic or rashness in the face of a dire warning, instead processes and absorbs important information silently.
Secretly takes a bottle of vodka to possibly self-medicate or cope with stress under surveillance.
Despite orders and intense pressure, drinks the whole bottle in defiance before entering combat.
Tries to maintain composure and join others despite physical and mental struggle.
Attempts to conceal the bottle of vodka from surveillance, showing situational awareness.
Under pressure, he decisively drinks the vodka and uses it as a weapon by smashing it against the camera.
Fails to make a smooth escape and trips badly, losing composure during a critical moment.
Charges toward the garage entrance despite disorientation, ultimately finds a suitable vehicle even while stumbling and hitting his head.
Recognizes the fuel type warning and verifies the fuel inside by dry heaving into the tank to confirm it's ethanol.
Shows momentary confusion and physical disorientation (legs rubber, stumbling, hitting head), but still manages to act effectively.
Shoots an opponent without hesitation and urinates in the tank before escaping.
Responds with sarcasm to Simon's encouragement ('Yeah? Anything else ya fuckin cheerleader?').
Drifts truck recklessly, wiping out two opponents, fires weapon at a drone.
Recovers quickly from being sick in the truck and continues driving aggressively to escape pursuers despite being physically impaired.
Recovers quickly from being spun out and physically sick, then continues driving aggressively.
Despite being injured and impaired, keeps focus and takes decisive action by leaning out and shooting at pursuing snowplows.
Drives aggressively and takes a dangerous risk by executing a power slide to escape, showing determination under pressure but little concern for safety or others.
Scrambles out of the crashed truck and runs for shelter, focused on survival without hesitation or expressed empathy.
Performs a high-speed power slide with his truck to clear a concrete wall and successfully escapes after the vehicle flips and crashes, quickly exiting the vehicle and seeking cover.
Fails to refuel or monitor the fuel level resulting in the truck hiccupping and going on empty in a critical moment.
His removal from Slayers rosters and upcoming events is reported; no direct emotional reaction or outreach shown in the excerpt.
Being recognized as the most prominent and skilled Slayer next to Ken Castle and on the brink of winning a full pardon and release.
Reported as fragged and removed from Slayer rosters amid unconfirmed news and technical difficulties, signaling uncertainty and lack of control.
Ignores the rider initially, but listens and considers her advice seriously before following her.
Does not immediately trust the rider Trace, asks her who she is.
Ignores the rider initially but quickly engages when Trace indicates urgency; considers his options carefully before deciding to follow her on the moto.
Recognizes Trace's voice from a prior encounter, showing good recall and situational awareness.
Decides to trust Trace's warning and promptly follows her through a complex and risky urban environment.
Casually insults others ('You guys suck') but without malice, showing blunt honesty.
Engages with new acquaintances with calm curiosity and open questions.
Calls out other players by saying 'You guys suck' confidently, disrupting their focus.
Looks over the people who broke him out, assessing the unexpected situation calmly.
Asks pointed questions regarding his own condition, showing intelligent engagement.
Does not display confusion or hesitation when hearing about complex modifications to his brain; responds with simple acknowledgement 'Alright...'.
Refuses to help despite urgent plea
Listens silently without engaging or explaining
Takes in the urgent request for help but chooses to walk away and refuses to help.
Implied to have escaped from maximum security penitentiary funded by his father's money; no direct interaction or warmth shown in this excerpt.
His escape from a maximum security penitentiary is implied as successful, showing skill and planning.
Kills Rick Rape violently to protect Angie.
Gently takes Angie's face in his palms and locks eyes with her after the violent act.
Shakes head trying to grasp situation but shows sincerity and care.
Gently pushes Angie's hands away when she moves toward his crotch, telling her 'This isn't you.'
Expresses anger and frustration but contains rage and shows concern for Angie's well-being.
Wipes away a tear from Angie's cheek, expresses love repeatedly, and shows emotional breakdown.
Screams at Gorge threateningly, promising violent retribution if he speaks again, causing Gorge to cower.
Quietly promises to take Angie somewhere safe to stop the controlling program and protect her.
Stares down Gorge and intimidates him into submission to protect Angie.
Breaks down emotionally despite high stakes.
Moves Angie tactically with weapon ready, navigates hallway and gets elevator without incident.
Absorbs a shotgun blast and struggles to recover despite severe pain.
Grabs Hackman, rips him out of the elevator, slams him into a wall, and head-butts him brutally to protect others.
Takes a bullet by stepping in front of Hackman’s shotgun blast to protect others.
Shoots cover fire and rescues Angie, breaking for the back exit.
Grabs Angie by the shoulders and urgently seeks direction from Gorge, showing concern for others' safety.
Continues to protect Angie by firing at threats and guiding her through dangerous places.
Maintains focus and composure amidst chaos without showing aggression towards innocent bystanders.
Kills enemies efficiently while protecting Angie and actively seeks direction by demanding Gorge to lead them.
Navigates a chaotic, unfamiliar environment (the underground rave) while maintaining focus on protection and movement.
Takes Angie's arm and leads her through chaos to escape danger.
Commands Gorge to run and protects Angie during a violent escape.
Uses violence decisively to defend himself and others in a dangerous situation.
Cradles Angie in his arms, stroking her hair while she is unconscious, showing care and concern.
Looks Gina Parker Smith straight in the eye and tells her 'If not... you're dead.'
Calmly assesses trustworthiness of Gina Parker Smith and bluntly threatens her to ensure honesty.
Slumps against the wall exhausted but continues to care for Angie attentively.
Asks straightforwardly what the next step is once new information is obtained.
Asks relevant questions about the sedation duration and implications of the anti-spyware program, showing understanding of the technical situation.
Responds calmly when prompted to talk by Humanz Brother, indicating readiness and confidence to engage.
Acknowledges the death of a friend and bitterly reflects on the failed experiment they were part of.
Responds curtly and guardedly to accusations and demands for information from Humanz Brother.
Walks down a sterile corridor dead calm, emotionless.
Sits calmly in a debriefing room and exchanges a light, slightly teasing greeting with Scotch.
Replies briefly and blandly to Scotch’s teasing, avoiding engagement and not matching his energy.
Calmly removes his gun and stares at it intensely, showing controlled emotional depth beneath his icy exterior.
Says 'I'm sorry' in response to Scotch noticing his condition, indicating some private regret or remorse.
Avoids eye contact and shows reluctance to open up about his condition.
Responds to Scotch's teasing and concern with calm composure, does not escalate emotionally.
Acknowledges he is not getting out, showing acceptance and clear understanding of his situation.
Does not reveal much, remains somewhat reserved and inscrutable, maintaining control over information.
Shows a moment of emotional vulnerability when staring intensely at his weapon, but does not lose composure outwardly.
His response 'I'm sorry' is vague and possibly self-directed, potentially indicating internal conflict but still keeping calm externally.
Visibly struggles emotionally and physically with internal turmoil, shows vulnerability by crying.
Points a gun at Scotch and shoots him despite apparent hesitation and apology.
Touches Angie's face, looks deep into her eyes, embraces her, and expresses desperation and emotion.
Tries to understand the situation about his daughter and expresses concern.
Quietly escapes from observation despite intense monitoring.
Handles deep emotional trauma but continues to deal with it rather than collapse.
Seeks emotional connection and strives to gather information despite apparent setbacks.
Appears overwhelmed and confused upon learning about his daughter's fate.
Immediately dismisses Gina Parker Smith's offer to come with him, spinning to face her and clearly conveying no chance she can join; then leaves her behind to pursue his mission alone.
Keeps to the trees, avoids confrontation with wild dogs instead of shooting them.
Drops into the estate stealthily, keeps to the trees, ready for threat but does not waste effort on non-threat (dogs run past him).
Runs toward the little girl Delia, calling her name and pounding on the glass to reach her.
Contains his anger and does not lash out despite provocation by Ken Castle.
Suppresses instinct to attack immediately and holds back to assess the situation despite strong impulse.
Grips weapon ready but recognizes the opposing men are unarmed and dancing, showing awareness and restraint.
Fights fiercely to protect Castle despite impossible odds and malfunctioning weapon.
Tosses aside dead weapon and runs toward Castle to defend him, showing loyalty and courage.
Engages in brutal hand-to-hand combat, showing determination and protective instinct.
Admits verbally to Ken Castle that he 'doesn't care about you' right after a moment of connection, revealing guardedness and reluctance to express warmth.
Follows Ken Castle confidently without hesitation, maintaining composure while entering potentially dangerous situations.
Does not attempt to exploit Castle's moment of vulnerability when he turns his back, instead choosing to follow quietly.
Responds to Ken Castle's explanation with sarcasm, showing skepticism and mental engagement.
Waves away the grip powder dust quickly, indicating alertness to potential hazards.
Absorbs a desperate tackle to stop an attacker, restrains him without lethal intent until he loses consciousness.
Dislocates attacker's shoulder and causes significant pain during restraint.
Comments to Ken Castle that Hackman should have been allowed to fight for himself.
Hears Hackman at the last second, spins to absorb the tackle, expertly grapples, dislocates opponent's shoulder and defeats him despite taking a cut to his own face.
Starts to move toward Castle with bad intent, attempts to kill him but hesitates, then ends up slicing his own leg to resist control.
Looks up at his daughter and Angie with eyes soaked with emotion after collapsing in front of them.
Does not react aggressively toward the Geek Squad escorts despite apparent threat to his daughter.
Allows Castle to knock him down repeatedly without retaliation, seemingly protecting or enduring for others' sake.
Swings his nails to mark Castle's stomach like Bruce Lee; shows skill in combat.
Gets repeatedly hit and dropped to the floor by Castle; slow to react to the door opening and the arrival of Angie and Delia.
Looks up slowly, showing fear and awareness of danger rather than decisive action.
Despite being beaten, maintains emotional connection, looking towards Delia and Angie, showing situational awareness beyond fighting.
Looks into Angie's eyes and seems to draw strength from her.
Attempts to stab Castle with a knife, trying to kill him under external control.
Strains and fights to resist external control and moves the knife away from Castle when regaining partial control.
Stabs the knife into the floorboards to disrupt control and try to break free.
Tries to stab Castle but is frozen and controlled by external commands, showing limits in fighting back.
Maintains intense focus and willpower to overpower Castle despite external interference.
Ultimately succumbs to Castle's control and is physically overpowered.
Uses a violent, ruthless tactic (stabbing Castle) to win the fight, showing a harsh side.
After defeating Castle, Kable immediately turns to comfort and embrace his family, gathering Delia and Angie in a warm, protective hug.
Senses an opportunity during a critical fight, uses psychological manipulation to distract opponent, then swiftly and decisively stabs and incapacitates him.
Maintains calm and control after the fight, shows awareness of theatrics but remains focused on family and situation.
Commands the GEEKS to shut off the nanex, effectively setting them free with a simple instruction, demonstrating his understanding of the system and his ability to take decisive action.
Does not verbally respond to the GEEK LEADER's compliment but shows internal resolve and seriousness through his expression, indicating confidence and control without needing to explain himself.
Checks on Delia, calls her 'sweetheart', smiles warmly, and allows Angie to touch his hand gently.
